reviews.text: Barcelo Atenea Mar is a great hotel. It is very modern, faces the Mediterranean, free internet cafe and close to a bus stop for easy access to the inner city.
reviews.title: Nice Hotel, Bad Location

reviews.text: we had no problem whatsoever with the hotel, but it could have been a little better if the hotel was more in the city.
reviews.title: great weekend breakaway

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2004, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This was a great success.
reviews.title: wonderful honeymoon getaway

reviews.text: I had booked the weekend break via teletext holidays (internet) on the Thursday at 23.00hrs and on the flight on the next day at 09.00!! I had no time to check alternative accommodation therefore was a bit unsure about what to expect. A huge relief when I found the hotel was great.
reviews.title: Very nice but not in the city center

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I'm fussy but I couldn't praise this better.
reviews.title: Pleasant place to lay your head

likes.disliked: — Room small, no drawers, lift took ages to arrive

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Booked with 1800hotels.ie.Great value.a bit out from city centre in village built for Olympics. Spacious, quiet, clean. Dinner EXCELLENT VALUE, superb food, Menu 19euro impossible to beat.
reviews.title: Excellent value hotel in beach area

likes.liked: — Spacious room, fantastic bed & curtains in quiet location near miles of beaches
likes.disliked: — A bit far out from city centre

reviews.text: Stayed in this hotel for 3 nights and would def recommend it. Room wasn't ready for check in as we arrived well before recommended check in time of 3pm but we were told we could change and freshen up in the hotel gym, which is small but adequate. Location is 2 mins walk to the nearest beach and around 15 mins bus ride into the city centre. Got a great value delicious 3 course meal in the hotel restaurant. Buffet breakfast was also delicious and they had a yummy chocolate cake that you could help yourself to!
reviews.title: Great Hotel, fab beach location.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel was right across the street from a beach. It was about a 10-15 minute walk to Port Olympic, and about a 5 Euro cab ride to La Rambla. I loved the location! As for cleanliness, it was extremely clean, and the hotel decor was fresh and new. The staff were reasonably friendly and parking was available for 15 euros a night.
reviews.title: Nice Rooms, great view!

likes.liked: — The fact that is was so new and the beach across the street
likes.disliked: — A long walk from Old town, but a cheap ca ride none the less

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: It's a big hotel, very clean and nice, location wise is perfect, next to one of the best beaches [Marbella] in Barcelona [there are nice beach parties Weekend nights as well] and bus 41 takes you in 10-15 minutes to the Barcelona city center.
reviews.title: Good Hotel and perfect location

likes.liked: — clean rooms, next to the beach

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: it lacks character and a personal service if that's what you are after.
reviews.title: Fab hotel!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We chose this hotel as it was a cheaper option than others more centrally located. Because it was a short walk to the metro, getting around Barcelona wasn't a problem. It was around a 20 minute walk to Port Olympic. We had an inexpensive cab ride to the airport.
reviews.title: A great hotel

reviews.text: Nearby was a lovely park, a mall and the beach (it was a little cold to spend time on it however).
reviews.title: Good for beach, not too bad for city if you're willing to travel!

likes.liked: — Free internet in lobby and spa!
likes.disliked: — Bit far from the main sites

reviews.text: The room wasn't huge, but very nicely decorated,stylish, comfortable and clean.
reviews.title: On the beach, but out of town (in a good way).

likes.liked: — Great location out of town, overlooking palm trees and the beach.
likes.disliked: — You're always a taxi ride (or a decent walk to the Metro) away from the main sights.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We ate in the hotel's restaurant once, the food was great; I had the nicest cod I've ever eaten!
reviews.title: Fantastic Hotel great for beach

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I would really recommend this hotel as a base to explore Barcelona.
reviews.title: well, we liked it

likes.liked: — I liked the beach front location

reviews.text: We stayed at the Barcelo' Atenea Mar in Barcelona as a pre-trip hotel stay for a cruise that left from the port in Barcelona. This was one of the hotels that the cruise line had available. Even though there had been cruise-line families and guests checking in and out for several weeks, the hotel did not seem comfortable handling multiple check-ins needing multiple rooms per party.
reviews.title: A business-man's hotel

reviews.text: We arrived early afternoon and were able to secure one of the two rooms we had booked. The check-in person was as helpful as she could be considering it was prior to the scheudled check-in time and they had had many late check-outs.
reviews.title: Perfect for the beach

reviews.text: We had two rooms, but not adjoining. They were both on the first floor just above the reception area. The elevators are very small and barely accomodated 2 adults, 2 children and accompanying luggage (2 small, 1 med. and 2 large suitcases).
reviews.title: The Average Atenea Mar

likes.disliked: — Room was noisy, Room key did not work (had to get it corrected twice before it worked OK), Shower

reviews.title: Close to beach - and subway!
reviews.text: To activate the electricity in the room, you have to put your key card into the slotted box on the wall as you enter. Even though the directions are on the folder that they put your key in, our check-in person did not point this out to us, so we had difficulty figuring out how to activate the lights. If it had been night-time, we would not have figured it out as the room is very dark with the curtains drawn (which makes it very nice for sleeping).

reviews.title: Great location and friendly personnel. above average
reviews.text: The beds are very comfortable although not plush by any means. The carpeting was "indoor - outdoor" but was clean. There was plenty of storage space in the closet.
